content:
Having a kitchenette or kitchen in your hotel room can be a huge advantage when traveling with kids. It's great that you had a positive experience with a kitchenette in Midtown, New York City. Having that flexibility to prepare meals and snacks can make a big difference in your travel experience.

When searching for hotels in Waikiki, be sure to look for rooms with kitchenettes or kitchens that fit your needs. Some hotels may offer microwaves, refrigerators, and sinks, while others may have full kitchens with stoves, ovens, and dishwashers. Make sure to check the hotel's website or contact them directly to confirm the kitchen amenities.

Additionally, you may also want to consider the following factors when booking a hotel with a kitchenette or kitchen:

* **Grocery shopping**: Research nearby grocery stores or markets where you can stock up on essentials and snacks.
* **Meal planning**: Plan your meals in advance to ensure you're making the most of your kitchenette or kitchen.
* **Cleaning**: Check if the hotel provides cleaning supplies or if you need to bring your own.
* **Space**: Consider the size of the kitchenette or kitchen and whether it will fit your needs.

By doing your research and planning ahead, you can make the most of your hotel's kitchenette or kitchen and enjoy a more comfortable and convenient stay in Waikiki with your kids.

If you have any more questions or need further recommendations, feel free to ask!
